title: Alexei Navalny, a life of resistance and sacrifice
summary: The main opponent of Russian President Vladimir Putin had survived a poisoning attempt in 2020. When he returned to his country after months of recovery in Germany, he knew he would end up in prison. He died there on Friday, aged 47.

title: Zelensky signs security agreement with France
summary: The Ukrainian president signed Friday in Paris a 10-year bilateral security agreement with France hours after he officialized a similar one with Germany.

title: Trump ordered to pay $355 million in New York fraud case
summary: A New York judge also barred the former US president from running companies in the state for three years.

title: DRC is considering reinstating the death penalty for military personnel
summary: This announcement comes as the Congolese army continues to retreat before the M23 rebel offensive in the country's east.

title: 'Uber announces a $7 billion share repurchase, a substantial gift to its shareholders'
summary: Rather than compensating its couriers and drivers, the app has opted to return profits to its shareholders and employees following its first annual profit. Why such a hurry? asks economic columnist, Philippe Escande.

title: 'Because we're shrinks, should our children be smarter and prettier?'
summary: Sophie Marinopoulos, a psychoanalyst and now a grandmother, speaks about the joys and trials of her daily life raising four children 'with joy,' and assessed the expectations and demands around motherhood today.

title: Biden says Navalny was 'so many things that Putin is not'
summary: The American president said he holds Putin and his 'thugs' responsible for the death of the Russian opposition leader.

title: The weapons France has supplied to Ukraine
summary: Le Monde was able to access the previously unreported list of military equipment France has sent to Ukraine since the start of the war, ahead of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's visit to Paris.

title: Macron says recognizing a Palestinian state 'not a taboo' for France
summary: Meeting in Paris with Jordan's King Abdullah II, the French president warned that an Israeli offensive in Rafah would be a new grave violation of international law.'

title: Why the right to bear arms remains entrenched in American culture and politics
summary: Adopted more than 230 years ago, the Second Amendment of the American Bill of Rights remains fundamental to the nation, despite repeated shootings.

title: French journalist says leaving India after expulsion threat
summary: Vanessa Dougnac, who had worked in India for over two decades, faced threats from authorities over her critical reporting deemed 'inimical' to national interests.

title: Ukraine signs bilateral security deal with Germany
summary: Volodymyr Zelensky met with Olaf Scholz in Berlin, and will sign a similar agreement with France later in the day.

title: West Virginia Senator Joe Manchin announces he won't run for president in 2024
summary: The centrist Democrat who often bucked his party's leadership had been considering a run for the American presidency.

title: Senegal president vows to hold election 'as soon as possible'
summary: Macky Sall, who faces mounting pressure at home and abroad, made the pledge after the West African country's top constitutional body overruled his decision to delay this month's vote.

title: Gérard Depardieu faces fourth sexual assault complaint
summary: A woman filed a complaint on January 9 saying the actor groped her and made inappropriate remarks while she was a 24-year-old assistant on the set of a film.

title: An aggressive anti-LGBTQ+ campaign mounts in Turkey
summary: There is growing hostility to progressive discourse on gender and family structures in Turkey. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has even called LGBTQ+ people a threat to society.

title: At the Berlinale, politics take center stage at the opening ceremony
summary: The wars in Gaza and Ukraine and the rise of the far-right in Germany loomed large over the first day of the German film festival.

title: Italy's public broadcaster RAI caught in controversies over Gaza war
summary: On-air statements about the war in the enclave have revealed political tensions in the public broadcasting sector, at a time when both majority and opposition parties have agreed on calling for an immediate ceasefire.

title: Ukrainian forces withdraw from Avdiivka
summary: Ukraine's military chief announced Saturday the withdrawal from Avdiivka, where defenders battled Russian forces for four months.

title: Paris 2024: Will metro Line 14, the Olympics' 'lifeline,' be fully operational in time?
summary: The extensions of the driver-less metro line will link Orly airport to the Olympic village in Saint-Denis. The line has closed for two weeks to conduct crucial tests.

title: America falls out of love with Tesla and electric vehicles
summary: The US automaker's shares have lost more than a quarter of their value since the start of the year. Tesla is not quite the futuristic company it used to be, dedicated to artificial intelligence and robotics

title: In Peru, a trial highlights violence against environmentalists
summary: Over the last decade, at least 45 environmentalists, most of them indigenous to the Amazon regions, have been murdered with impunity, with their cases largely overlooked by the nation.

title: The Metropolitan Museum's curator wants to bring it into the 21st century
summary: Max Hollein has reorganized its European collections with the idea of confronting cultures and adopting a less ethnocentric approach.

title: Japan announces successful launch of next-gen H3 rocket
summary: The H3 rocket blasted off from a launch pad at the Tanegashima Space Center on time Saturday morning, two days after its originally scheduled liftoff which was delayed due to bad weather.

title: Israeli hostages' families are exhausted and divided: 'It's a lie to say that everyone will come back'
summary: Should Israel prioritize war or negotiations with Hamas? Relatives of the hundred or so people still sequestered in the Gaza Strip are divided on the attitude to adopt towards the government.

title: Thailand's ex-premier Thaksin to be released from jail on Sunday
summary: Speaking to reporters on Saturday, Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin said Thaksin Shinawatra will be released from prison 'on the 18th' and handled 'according to the rule of law'.

title: Alexei Navalny, the thorn in Vladimir Putin's side, has died
summary: Navalny, one of Russia's most significant opposition leaders, died in jail on Friday, according to the country's prison service.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Hotel prices are no longer soaring, as Airbnb supply booms
summary: Prices for hotel rooms in Paris during the Olympics are declining, although they remain well above the usual rates. The number of listings on Airbnb, meanwhile, has skyrocketed.

title: Cognac drives down French wine and spirits exports in 2023
summary: Sales of French spirits outside France fell by 5.9% in 2023, which remained a good year for the industry.

title: Discovering Paris's Bois de Vincennes with mycologist Marc-André Selosse
summary: Biologist Marc-André Selosse first found his passion in this large Paris region forest. He explores the wildest part of the wood, in search of polypores, leucopaxillus and other treasures.

title: Alexei Navalny dies taking with him 'the last hopes' of a free Russia
summary: Vladimir Putin's main opponent died on Friday in the secrecy and isolation of an Arctic prison. His still-unexplained death has provoked worldwide condemnation and despair among his supporters.

title: Unplugging from screens, a personal battle: 'The phone is turned off, put away in a bag and kept in a different room'
summary: As Emmanuel Macron looks to regulate children's screen time, Le Monde asked adults about their strategies for controlling their own usage.

title: Alexei Navalny's widow Yulia Navalnaya: 'They will be punished'
summary: The wife of the Russian opposition figure learned of her husband's death on Friday, while attending the 60th Munich Security Conference, to which she had been invited.

title: 'Living apart together,' couples who keep separate homes
summary: Anne Chirol reports on the digital archetypes of our time, from the #tradwife to the #fuckboy. This week, partners who wish to live in their own nest and see each other when they decide to.

title: The historic conviction of the Michigan school shooter's mother
summary: In 2021, 15-year-old Ethan Crumbley murdered four students at his Michigan high school. On February 6, his mother was found guilty of manslaughter.

title: Zelensky obtains unprecedented military support from Paris and Berlin
summary: The Ukrainian president signed security agreements with both France and Germany on Friday.
